mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Force Commitment, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Open Drafting

name: Destinies: Adversity Module
description:
Add Providence rewards alongside Adversity challenges and boons for increased tactical gameplay in any Destinies scenario!

At the beginning of each scenario, a Providence Card will be randomly selected to set the scene and offer potential rewards to the bravest and most enduring adventurers.

On each day of your adventure, new Adversity Cards will be drawn that impact all players. These cards will present challenges and difficulties to overcome as you endeavor to fulfill your destiny.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Resistance: Inquisitor Tile Promo
description: The Inquisitor Promo tile add the optional Inquisitor role to The Resistance. The Inquisitor follows the same rules as the Lady of the Lake tile from The Resistance: Avalon.

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – VT-49 Decimator Expansion Pack
description:
A durable vessel capable of independent patrols, the VT-49 Decimator’s size and power blurred the line between shuttle and corvette—but the same qualities that endeared it to up-and-coming Imperial officers also made it useful to agents of the Emperor, under whom failure was not an option.

With the VT-49 Decimator Expansion Pack, you can bring a single VT-49 Decimator to your Galactic Empire squadrons. In addition to one pre-painted and finely detailed VT-49 miniature, you’ll also find three ship cards matching the VT-49 Decimator ship cards from the Galactic Empire Conversion Kit, as well as a selection of thirteen reprinted upgrade cards, giving you the freedom to add vital crew and deadly devices to your ship. Finally, two Quick Build cards let you get your Decimator in the fight right away with predefined combinations of ship and upgrade cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fantasy Flight Games, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Nox Promo
description:
Nox is a promotional character for the game Krosmaster: Arena.

Nox is the main antagonist from the French anime Wakfu. A former human and now an insane Xelor (time mage), he seeks to drain the world of enough Wakfu (life force) to power the Eliacube, a tiny cube of immense power. He hopes to use the Eliacube to reverse time to save his family from their unfortunate deaths.

As a character in Krosmaster: Arena, he takes on the role of a mid-range attacker/disruptor. His skills as an Xelor allows him to steal and disrupt his victim's time flow, reducing the actions they can take while fueling his own to create devastating and debilitating combos. His heavy armor will keep him alive in the thick of battle, and when his armor fails, he can warp away to safety.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Track Events Mini-Expansion
description: A mini-expansion of eight event cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign. Each card features a unique condition that changes the game. Select two cards at random each game.

description:
This Expansion pack adds 2 new Knights - Astolfo and Marfisa - plus new Encounter cards and also expands the size of the wood to 63 tiles.

Game components:

18 area cards, including City, Swamp, Mountain and pool



16 small cards,consisting of:


2 Knights (Astolfo and Marfisa)

13 denizens (Bear, Crone, Friar, Griffin, Immortal, Nymph, Ogre, Pilgrim, Sorcerer, Sphinx, Tartar, Tyrant and Wife)

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Through the Waste
description:
This expansion focuses on vehicles, gangs, and lawmen of the Waste. It features:

- 16 Part Cards, with new rules for tuning vehicles that enable you to add armor, weapons, and upgrades to turn your ride into a mechanized companion

- 4 Vehicle Sheets: Dirt Bike, Pursuit Car, Pick-up, and ATV, with new stats and special abilities

- 4 Malfunction Cards

- 3 Wasteland Cards featuring new Gangs roaming cracked Australian highways

- 1 Adventure: Deadly Cargo, a dynamic narrative about expert drivers competing for the ultimate prize. It features unique rules for vehicle combat and 2 Special Cards with hidden content for you to discover.

- 1 Knight: Frank Strzelecki, the Judge, with his accompanying sheet, 4 Upgrade Cards, and a highly-detailed miniature

You get two of each 'Mech, for a total of 110 pieces. Also included are 24 card stands and a book of 55 filled-out Battletech record sheets, one for each 'Mech."

1985 ... FASA 1625 ... ISBN 1555600379

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Skystrike Academy Squadron Pack
description:
Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Skystrike Academy Squadron Pack includes talented and loyal pilots such as Vult Skerris and Ciena Ree, featuring new abilities and upgrades based on their appearances in Star Wars: Rebels and Lost Stars. In addition to these pilots, players will also find one TIE/D Defender miniature and two TIE/in Interceptor miniatures featuring bold alternate paint schemes in this expansion, adding even more diversity to Imperial squadrons!

—description from the publisher

name: Bargain Quest: Golem Promo Hero
description:
The Golem is an unusually adaptable hero who is unlike any other! Though it does not have any inherent class icons. The Golem's Customize ability allows you, the shopkeeper, to decide how best to prepare this hero for battle.

When the Golem enters your shop you can choose any one class icon, the golem can then equip any items of that class! Though its starting purse is average and its base stats are rather average, the Golem makes up for it with steady, steam-powered reliability! (Plus it's pretty dang cute.)

The Golem Pack also contain alternative art for the heroes of Black Market and An alternative art for the Evil Adventurers Boss.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Inquisitors' TIE Expansion Pack
description:
An experimental craft reserved for elite agents of the Empire such as the dreaded Inquisitors, the TIE Advanced v1 has numerous cutting-edge features that skilled pilots can leverage to deadly effect. The craft’s high-precision thrusters and flexible controls let its pilots tirelessly pursue their prey across the galaxy.

This expansion pack includes everything you need to add one TIE Advanced v1 ship to your Imperial squadrons, including reprints of four ship cards and five upgrade cards for the benefit of new players, as well as two Quick Build cards to get you off the ground even faster.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

description: The Summons of the Deep expansion to the Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game continues with its third monthly Asylum Pack of 40 fixed cards, The Antediluvian Dreams. It contains 20 different never-before-seen cards that place a new found emphasis on the Combat struggle, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Get Bit! Additional Player Expansion
description:
Get Bit! is a 2 to 6 player game. These expansions allow another player to jump in the water and try their hand against the hungry shark.

The Pink Robot Expansion includes the pink figure, Spider Woman stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The Orange Robot Expansion includes the orange figure, Bruce stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The Green Zombie Expansion includes the green figure, zombie stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The Black Panda Expansion includes the black figure, panda stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The 'Frankenstein creature" 7 cards

The second editions of some of the expansions include the dolphin card, but the Dolphin Die expansion can be used without the extra card - just use the highest card as the dolphin card (this card would be replaced with the dolphin card if it was used).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Roundhammer 1943
description:
From the publisher's website:

"At the start of 1943 Churchill and Roosevelt had divergent views on the conduct of the war. The British Prime Minister favoured a strategy which focussed on the peripheries of Europe: Italy was a ripe fruit ready to be plucked, via Sicily. For the American President on the contrary, Germany was the sole objective. The enemy was to be struck right in the heart of his war economy, the Ruhr, and by the most direct route: France ! Two operations are studied in the game : "Round up" and "Sledgehammer" which for the Anglo-American general staffs quickly became one operation, "Roundhammer".

The Trident conference in Washington in May 1943 gave Churchill his way, clearing the road for the invasion of Italy. The Quebec conference in August 1943 (Quadrant) cancelled Roundhammer definitively in favour of the future Operation Overlord in 1944, developed in the game Liberty Roads.

But what would have happened if the allies had dared to launch Operation Roundhammer in mid-September 1943, as the generals had planned?

At this date, the Atlantic Wall defences were still barely started on many beaches. A large number of the German divisions in France at that time were undergoing training and were not yet operational. As for the Panzer Divisions, they were not yet equipped with the formidable Panther tank.

But on the allied side there was a lack of US units. The majority had been sent to the Mediterranean, or were training in the USA. The amphibious capacity of the invasion force was far from sufficient and British reserves were very weak. Worse yet, aerial supremacy was not complete with an omnipresent Luftwaffe. Mission impossible?

The Roundhammer 1943 module allows you to supply an answer through this what-if game ! The extension of Liberty Roads includes those extra units present in Western Europe at the time, along with new supports and Atlantikwall/D-Day markers, with a ‘1943’ ambiance."
categories: Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016
description:
Description from the publisher:

Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 is pretty much what the name says it is: A board game advent calendar for 2016 that contains 24 small expansions (2 of which are categorized as accessories on BGG: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Kookie (promo character) and Quadropolis: Christmas Tiles) for 24 different games, from different publishers. The game rules for each item are included, but they were also posted separately on the publisher's website on each day from December 1st to 24th.

Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 was sold in two formats: a giant box (as with the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 in which each item has its own "window") and a small compact box for the international traveler.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Last Night on Earth 'Airstrike' Game Supplement
description:
From publisher web:

The'Airstrike' Supplement is a Web-exclusive for 'Last Night on Earth' and features a new scenario and ten new game cards. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else. They feature all new artwork.

Though radio communications have been spotty, the Heroes have learned that the military has begun to mobilize and have declared the entire area around Woodinvale and Timber Peak to be a ‘Stage 4’ quarantine zone... and that doesn’t sound good. By the number of jets flying overhead, it is clear that they are planning an airstrike to level the entire area. The only chance for survival is to find enough flares to let them know there are still survivors!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Sumeria: 2-Player Expansion
description:
A two-player expansion of the Sumeria board game, released as a promo for the game at Essen '09. It adds 24 more wooden pieces (6 in each of the original player colours) bringing the total to 20 per player. It also includes a sheet of rules and a sticker to show the 4th player turn which only happens in the 2-player game. The whole thing comes packaged in a baggie and cannot be played without the base game.

Expands:

Sumeria

mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Core Space: Cygnus Crew
description:
This pack contains a fully playable Trader crew for Core Space, including the massive Chit and the veteran Hunter. Get to know Captain Sondar and his crew in a thrilling new mission, and add a twist to your regular games with the new Assistance Cards and equipment such as the Bio-Tag Rifle.

Contents: 4 Trader Miniatures / 4 Character Boards / 4 Class Boards / 1 Ship Board / 3 Event Cards / 11 Equipment Tokens / 1 Mission Briefing and Rules Booklet

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Specialists Personnel Expansion
description:
Whether driven by creed or devotion to the Empire, Imperial Commanders are dangerous and cunning opponents, feeling no qualms about resorting to ruthless and violent tactics. These commanders can make a name for themselves on the battlefields of Star Wars: Legion by making the best use of the specialized personnel at their disposal to complete their objectives.

With the Imperial Specialists Personnel Expansion, you can field a generic Imperial Officer unit complete with three new command cards to add more tactical possibilities to your Imperial ground operations. Accompanying them are three specialists that can be added to other units in your army: a communications specialist to better coordinate with your troops, a medical droid to administer first aid to your troops, and an astromech droid to repair your vehicles on the fly.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Realms: Union Drone
description:
Star Realms: Union Drone is the Origins Game Fair 2017, Gen Con 2017, PAX West 2017 (PAX West 2017 versions were also distributed at PAX Unplugged) and SPIEL 2017 promo card for Star Realms.

It is a Blob / Star Empire Ship, that deals 3 damage, and upon trashing the card gives you 2 to spend.

All editions of this card are identical except for the con-specific logo in the lower right of the graphic.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Reikland Reavers – Human Blood Bowl Team
description:
Description from the publisher:

Known during their first few seasons as the Altdorf Acolytes, the team who became the Reikland Reavers quickly established a reputation for their great skill and ability on the pitch. Some judicious transfer decisions, helped by the impressively deep pockets of original owner DD Griswell Snr., has seen the team rise to the top during their long life. Now, with DD’s great-grandson JJ Griswell Jr. at the helm, the Reikland Reavers are probably the finest all-round team in the world.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Temporum: Alternate Realities
description:
Description from the publisher:

What is time? Is it like a river? Or maybe an ocean? Is it like up, but sideways? Is it churning chaos, background noise, held together only briefly by our own awareness of it? You don't know. You just work the machinery; someone else built it. To you, time is a means to an end, a glorious end in which humanity's crowning achievement turns out to be your own benevolent rule. It's a simple process of weeding through the alternatives, snipping prudently — an ungrateful utopia here, a useless revolution there. In the end, from the Age of Atlantis to the Zombie Apocalypse, the eras will sing your praise.

Temporum: Alternate Realities, an expansion for Temporum, adds 48 more Zones and 60 more Player cards, plus chits and cards used by the new Zones.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Naturopolis: Points of Interest
description:
A one card assistant visits Naturopolis.

Points of Interest is a starting card that boosts your score if you surround it with the same type of block.


1-card expansion that (almost) mirrors Sprawlopolis: Points of Interest.


Anyone that's been on our discord for a while probably knows how much I hate easter eggs. Especially when referencing different games or universes.

Well I made an exception to the rule as the art for Naturopolis: Points of Interest started to come in we noticed that the point of interest (a rainbow over some more prominent flowers) really looked like a Sprawlopolis curved road shape. We laughed and made sure it wasn't in the same position as the roads to avoid any confusion and kept moving forward. As time went on we realized that not only is it still kind of confusing as it looks like a road just in a different position, but IT SHOULD JUST BE A ROAD.

So here it is, the first Point of Interest that introduces new rules. This rainbow is also a road, and it's a road that does not count towards your road tax. If you ever needed a little buff to help your score, Points of Interest is there for you, and this one can help prevent you from losing yet another point (actually 2 points in Naturopolis!).
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Layering, Tile Placement

name: Rolling Heights: Kickstarter Promo Pack – Designer and Angry Ape Micro Expansion
description:
Big Cities have a way of attracting Big Problems!

The newly built city of Rolling Heights is being attacked by a giant creature! Will the defenders of Rolling Heights capture the beast before it destroys the city?

Find out with the 3-5minute bonus mini-game included with all Kickstarter pledges! One player takes the role of the beast trying to destroy the city by knocking over the building. The other players are the defenders of the city and try to capture the beast before all is lost.

In addition, John D Clair Bonus Building Tiles are in the expansion.
Each of these 5 bonus buildings are themed after one of AEG's other games that John D Clair designed.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Ser Snapjaw
description:
Ser Snapjaw is the greatest Wyrm Claw Exemplar in an age. Legendary among lesser kobolds, they rally to Ser Snapjaw with zeal, his cunning leadership allowing them to fight with discipline that matches the mightiest armies.

This model may played in your game of Super Dungeon Explore as either a Wyrm Claw Exemplar Hero or as the dreaded mini-boss, Ser Snapjaw.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, MESAboardgames, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Stronghold Games

name: Empires of the Void: Key to the Universe
description:
On every inhabited world in the known galaxy, the Tolmek appeared, a race of pan-dimensional beings of immense power. Everywhere their message was the same: "We are dying and must choose a successor." The Tolmek are the keepers of the Key to the Universe, a powerful artifact that holds the secrets of their power. They will give this Key to the race that proves themselves most capable and worthy. The Tolmek are watching. Will you inherit the Key to the Universe?

The small expansion Empires of the Void: Key to the Universe is designed to make the game more fun and balanced. Players now have a fourth action each round that can be used to perform new actions. One of the new actions is called Enslave, which increases the income of conquered planets. Also included are technology boards, which replace tech tokens and have a number of new technologies that open up new paths to victory. Four additional alien races provide more choices for players. Key to the Universe also has a new, revised rulebook for Empires of the Void that makes the game easier to learn and more clearly explains how to play.

Key to the Universe, currently in beta-testing, is available as a free downloadable, print-and-play expansion here:

http://www.redravengames.com/empires-of-the-void-key-to-the-...
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – City of Secrets
description:
Explore the twisting alleys of the capital of Westeros in City of Secrets, the second Chapter Pack in the King's Landing cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game!

As the sixth cycle of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game continues, you leave the plot of A Song of Ice and Fire behind to freely explore the world of Westeros. Shadows haunt the streets, closing in from the North, the East, and the South, and dark prophecies speak of terrors just on the horizon. Perhaps the time of great Houses and powers has passed.

Those who do not fight for a king or queen find a new agenda that can allow them to join the brotherhood without banners in the hollow hill. This Chapter Pack also continues to develop the shadow keyword, allowing your battles for the Iron Throne to take on an added level of intrigue with shadowy new events to give you the edge by embracing the true nature of your faction.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

description:
Venkman, Winston, and their companion Slimer take to the streets to battle against Zuul, who spawns Abominations as if there were none on the board!

4 minis with rules, cards and player boards. Contains components to be playable with the 1st and 2nd Editions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies

name: Federation Commander: Boosters
description:
FEDERATION COMMANDER: LINE OF BATTLE - Includes 9 laminated full-color 8.5" x 11" ship diagrams. Line of Battle is a duplicate set of the ship cards that were in BATTLESHIPS ATTACK (except no Starbase card), also included is a four page scenario booklet.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER PACK ZERO - Sub-titled "intelligence briefing" it includes one ship each from the Romulans, Gorns, Hydrans, Lyrans, WYN Star Cluster, and Inter-Stellar Concordium, plus a master weapons card and the preliminary rules for the weapons of these six factions.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #91 - includes the Federation Heavy Cruiser with rear phasers, Original Federation Dreadnought, Original Federation Destroyer, Federation DDM Destroyer, Federation DDG Destroyer with missiles, Federation DDL Destroyer with plasma torpedoes, Federation Scout, and the Federation Tug.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #92 - includes the Federation New Drone Cruiser, Klingon D5D Drone Cruiser, Romulan SparrowHawk-M Escort Cruiser, Kzinti Medium Drone Cruiser, Gorn Escort Light Cruiser, Tholian Web Patrol Cruiser, Lyran Escort Cruiser,and Seltorian Escort Cruiser.


The ADB, Inc. is providing online ship packs as it is cheaper and you can printout and laminate as many ship cards as you want. New factions include the Frax and the Omega empires.

BOOSTERS 1 - 3 expand Klingon Border (Klingon, Federation, Kzinti)


FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #1 - Includes 7 laminated full-color ship diagrams. Booster #1 includes more of the Federation ships in the Klingon Border boxed set. Plus one entirely new ship, the Federation Command Cruiser.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #2 - Includes 7 laminated full-color ship diagrams. Booster #2 includes more of the Klingon ships in the Klingon Border boxed set. Plus one entirely new ship, the Klingon D7C Command Cruiser.

BOOSTERS 13 - 15 expand Tholian Attack (Tholian, Seltorian, Neo-Tholian)

FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #14 - Includes 8 laminated full-color ship diagrams. Booster #14 includes two entirely new ships: Seltorian New Heavy Cruiser (new ship), Two Seltorian Destroyers, Two Neo-Tholian Frigates, Two Neo-Tholian Light Cruisers, Tholian Heavy Web Cruiser (new ship).



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #15 - Includes 8 laminated full-color ship diagrams. Booster #15 includes two new ones: Seltorian Light Raiding Dreadnought (new ship), Two Seltorian Frigates, Two Tholian Disruptor War Cruisers (new ships), Two Neo-Tholian Destroyers, Tholian Web Tender.


BOOSTERS 16 - 18 expand Battleships Attack (Federation, Kzinti, Neo-Tholian, Hydran, Romulan, Klingon, Gorn)

name: Phantom League: Pilot Academy
description:
Phantom League: Pilot Academy, the second expansion for Phantom League, includes two separate and major optional additions:


Battle rules, which change the battle system radically, and
Galactic Balance, which make missions have a larger effect than just Recognition, and Surface Missions, which is another way to gather Recognition (and affect Galactic Balance)


Phantom League: Pilot Academy is meant to make a player's immersion in the world of Phantom League even deeper, while offering more tactical choices during battles. Phantom League: Pilot Academy can be used without Mostly Harmless, the first expansion for PL, although it includes a separate rules booklet for those who do use Mostly Harmless.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Hallertau: Promo-Deck
description: 30-card Gateway promo deck first handed out at Gen Con 2022.
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Post-Napoleonic
mechanics: Advantage Token, Automatic Resource Growth, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Battlemist: The Sails of War
description:
The first expansion for Battlemist includes a large sea map, numerous ship counters, and new record/reference sheets. In addition to the sea area, it adds seafaring, trade, and initiative elements; new twists for the Hero and Quest parts of the game; and a new victory condition (finding and controlling the "Mystical Lands").

Expands:

Battlemist
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Modular Board

name: Evolution: New World – Butterfly Effect
description:
Every ecosystem is a complex combination of living organisms and the environment. Even a small change in any element affects the entire system, but balance is usually restored quickly. However, sometimes a random event leads to the butterfly effect – an unpredictable cascade of changes that can completely transform the whole biosphere.

The Butterfly Effect expansion gives you a new and unique way to play Evolution: New World. In the box, you’ll find:
- 13 new traits and the Seashore Area. Add more gameplay depth and create dynamic survival strategies for your animals.
- The Solo mode. In the Alien World scenario you will fight 1 on 1 against the merciless Dominator and insatiable Devastator for supremacy or create your own monsters to compete with.
- Additional tokens. With the expansion, up to 6 players can enjoy Evolution together.
- Butterfly Effect scenario. Start a chain reaction of random events that affect the game’s course and change the evolutionary process.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation

name: Nightfall: Destiny Collins Promo
description:
Publisher blurb to be added here***




Destiny Collins knows how to recruit the help you need. Whether she needs to sacrifice herself or is able to sweet talk them into submission, anyone opposing Destiny will soon be facing more then her alone.

The pack comes pre-wrapped with:
1 Destiny Collins draft card
7 Destiny Collins cards

Destiny Collins is one of the promos designed along with Nightfall: Blood Country.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Mamma Mia: Double Ingredients
description:
Mamma Mia: Double Ingredients is a promotional expansion for Mamma Mia consisting of 10 double ingredient cards, two in each of the five ingredients.

During game set-up, the double ingredient cards are substituted into the deck in place of two ingredients of each type. For game play, a double ingredient is handled exactly the same as the single ingredients, but of course count as two ingredients of that kind.

If an ingredient is needed to complete an order, double ingredients on display must be used first. If necessary, a player must overpay, which also applies to double ingredients played from the hand to complete an order.

Also included with Spielbox Magazine #2/2015.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory

name: Epic Card Game: Pantheon – Furios vs Maligus
description:
The forests of Danabrae show their daily reverence to Furios, but the Dark One, Maligus, threatens the balance. When Father Nature summons, the world answers. Will that be enough against the encroaching destruction that follows in the footsteps of the hidden evil?

Epic Card Game: Pantheon is an expansion for the Epic Card Game that's packaged in six non-random booster packs (Furios vs Maligus, Helena vs Zaltessa, Angeline vs Scara, Gareth vs Lashnok, Shadya vs Valentia, and Riksis vs Tarken), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards, 2 deity/token cards, and 1 double sided token card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Bloodborne: The Card Game – Moon Presence
description:
Moon Presence is a promotional Final Boss card included in the Bloodborne: the Card Game – Game Night Kit.

The rules for Moon Presence are as follows:
At the end of each Hunter's attack step, deal 1 damage to the hunter(s) who dealt the least damage to the Monster this round (this damage cannot be prevented).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

description:
A set of 2 cards given out to backers of The Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

These cards provide new movement options for your pieces.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Twilight Imperium: The Outer Rim
description:
Twilight Imperium: The Outer Rim is the fourth and last expansion for Twilight Imperium: 1st edition. It adds two new races, 13 new hex tiles (to form a fifth galactic ring) and extra rules (and counters) for Leaders and Shock Troops.

Part of the Twilight Imperium Series.

Expands:

Twilight Imperium


Sister Expansions:

Twilight Imperium: Borderlands

name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Brebo Bigshot Character Pack
description:
In the World of Warcraft , there are many heroes and many perils. As each foe falls, a new enemy is revealed; as each hero falters a new champion stands forth. Now, new heroes have risen to take their place in the Hall of Legends!

Brebo Bigshot, a Gnome mage, sets the landscape ablaze with his devastating fire magic abilities. His arcane prowess provides him magical armors and the power to incinerate foes with fiery attacks, even able to turn an opponent into a Living Bomb!

Not a complete game. A copy of World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game is required to play.

Game Contents:
28 Challenge Cards
23 Ability Cards
9 Character Tokens
4 Character Cards
1 Character Miniature
4 Quests
4 Discover Tokens
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Tsukuyumi: Full Moon Down – Dark Crusade
description:
When the Marduk Order started their offensive against Tsukuyumi, the boldest and most renown knights of the Order were sent on the hardest mission in the history of the great battles against the wyrms: venture into the innerst of the moon and finish what the Kami Hunters began.

Whilst their brothers of the KG 03 were send to fight the Oni from the ground, the KG 01, were deployed directly on the moon 3000 kilometers above the ocean soil. From there, the 5 dragonslayers began their journey into the core of the moon.

Buried in the bodies of their fallen foes in their pierced battlesuits, the knights of the KG 01 were imbued with Tsukuyumi's power and became Oni. But due to their training and their faith they were able to resist the transformation and keep their own will. With their new powers they patched their battlesuits with organic mass and ascended from the inner core of the moon. Half Oni and half knight. Ready to rain havoc on whoever steps in the way of their crusade. Their DARK CRUSADE.

Playstyle

The Dark Crusade are immensely powerful. But like the KG 03 they only have few units. In fact they have even less units then their righteous brothers, namely three.

As the Dark Crusade are kind of Oni themselves they can to certain amount interact and even control the Oni.
All Oni adjacent to Grendel count as units of the Dark Crusade and can be moved by the player and can even perform attacks.

As long as Lilith is in play, areas with Oni in them can not be conquered and finally every area Samael enters gains the Tsukuyumi area property.

Oh, and I almost forgot Baal. But he just sits in his drop pod (The KG 01 homezone) and shoots everybody who comes near him.
Like the KG 03 the Dark Crusade wants to dictate the pace of the game right from the start and center the attention on the moon and areas that a worth more VP.

The Dark Crusade really are the new powerhouse in town.

Did I mention that Grendel has an atomic bomb for a heart?

No? And guess what, he can blow it up, inflicting tons of damage! Literally TOOOONS of damage.

So are you ready to expose yourselves to Tsukuyumi's pheromones and step inside a tainted battlesuit to bring wrath upon your opponents?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Yunnan: Tu Di Gong Shrine
description:
Promotional item given away at Spiel 2013 for those who bought Yunnan at the fair.

The Tu Di Gong Shrine is a progress building. The progress of the shrine allows you to double the progress of 1 of the other progress buildings you successfully bid on.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Worker Placement

name: Triplock: The Factory Solo Pack
description:
The Second Solo Episode for Triplock
Dive back into the mysterious city of New London and follow the Stranger into The Factory. New challenges await inside. Use the new character, Madigan, to add more strategies and abilities to your solo and versus mode repertoire. Featuring additional lore, story, and solo replayability, The Factory is the perfect start to enhancing your Triplock experience.

This solo pack comes with a large Location card, 5 Room cards, and a Character: Madigan, which includes 2 Character cards (one large and one small).
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Hyena-class Droid Bomber Expansion Pack
description:
Baktoid Armor Workshop’s Hyena-class droid bomber is a wartime evolution of the Trade Federation’s Vulture-class droid fighter. Carrying an extensive payload of experimental and deadly ordnance provided by the Techno Union, the Hyena is a nasty surprise to any Republic loyalist who dismisses the danger posed by “mere” droids.

Compatible with Vulture swarm tactics, Hyena-class bombers add lethal new layers to Separatist squadrons. Within the Hyena-class Droid Bomber Expansion Pack, you'll find everything you need to add some heavy firepower to your Separatist Alliance squadrons, including six ship cards, 10 upgrade cards, and two Quick Build cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Paper Tales: Ce qui forge les légendes
description:
This second expansion for Paper Tales contains 3 new buildings, 14 new units and 9 cards of a new type: Legendary Artefacts! These are very powerful and not affected by aging or Kingdom size limitations, but also very expensive to play.

Note: this expansion can be combined with the first one (Beyond the Gates) to play with 1, 6 or 7 players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Night's Watch Intro Deck
description:
Join the battle for the Iron Throne with the Night's Watch Intro Deck for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! This pre-constructed deck introduces you to the mechanisms and key characters of Night's Watch to provide a stable foundation and highlight the faction's unique features. By recruiting soldiers from your enemy’s ranks, you will be prepared to protect Westeros for this night and for all nights to come.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Agents: The 'Secret' Agents
description: Expansion for The Agents. Adds 16 new agent cards to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Warhammer Quest: Chaos Adversary Cards
description:
Expand and extend your games of Warhammer Quest – both in the glittering lair of the Gaunt Summoner in Silver Tower and the subterranean catacombs of Shadows Over Hammerhal – with this set of cards, containing rules that add 41 Chaos Adversaries for you to battle against, using miniatures from your Warhammer Age of Sigmar collection.

Each of the cards features a profile and special rules for a model, with a behaviour table on the reverse. The cards either have rules for Exotic Adversaries, as detailed in Warhammer Quest, or Mighty Adversaries – rules for this type of Adversary are provided in the box.

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Redemption and Return
description:
Description from the publisher:

“I have to face him.”
–Luke Skywalker, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

The battle for Endor has raged in three arenas—on the Forest Moon, in the skies around the Death Star, and in the Emperor’s tower, as the Lords of the Sith confront the last Jedi. Now, with the Redemption and Return Force Pack for Star Wars: The Card Game, you can play out these iconic conflicts in your own games.

Like the other Force Packs of the Endor cycle, Redemption and Return follows the climactic events of Return of the Jedi while introducing new mission cards to change your strategies and methods. These missions are objective cards that you can play under your opponent’s control, which offer powerful rewards when they’re finally destroyed. In addition to new missions, the ten new objective sets (two copies each of five distinct sets) included in this expansion offer new versions of Luke Skywalker and Emperor Palpatine to expand your options and inspire your deck-building.

Contains objective sets 212-216.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: 100 Swords: The Darkness Dungeon Builder Set
description:
100 Swords is a sword based dungeon crawling micro deck builder! Load up with as much as you can carry and run head first into the dungeon, exploring rooms and revealing monsters, all while keeping track of hidden treasures and swords!

During play, you must efficiently play the 5 cards in your hand for any combination of movement, strength, or energy. Movement advances you deeper into the dungeon allowing you to peek at or reveal the cards along the way. Monsters you find can only be defeated with strength. New items (and swords!) are acquired by spending cards in your hand for energy. Many items have effects that will further expand your tactical options as your deck grows.

As you defeat monsters and pick up loot, do your best to remember where everything is hidden. Treasures and slain monsters are worth gold, so get collecting! Once the dungeon has been thoroughly ransacked, or the boss is defeated, whoever has the most gold wins!

You can use Dungeon Builder Sets to spice up your dungeon. Each set contains 15 cards (including a new Boss) that can be slapped onto a standalone dungeon to lengthen your game and add new challenges and puzzles to solve! The Darkness Dungeon Builder Set focuses heavily on vaporizing and hiding cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Yashima: Legend of the Icy Peaks
description:
Up here in the Icy Peaks, the weather is as unforgiving as the villagers. But not every heart here is cold. Prove yourself with shows of honor and solidarity, and the locals will welcome you beside their hearth. Something worse than cold awaits those unfortunate enough to spend the night outside on these mountains...

Yashima: Legend of the Icy Peaks is a fifth-player expansion to the fast-paced combat game, Yashima: Legend of the Kami Masters. This expansion adds two new kami masters and one new kami, adding an epic trove of new character abilities and strategies to the core game!

Gives you everything you need to add one additional player to the base game!
• Are you ready for 5-player free-for-all combat?
• Combine with Yashima: Legend of the Deep Woods for epic 6-player team-based showdowns!
• Play as Yuki, armed with ice and a cold heart. Silence your foes by freezing out their karma and surroundings into deadly terrain.
• Play as Mitsuo, the blind bard, accompanied by his monkey, Saru. Control two miniatures on the board, dancing about your foes from multiple locations!
• Join forces with the Yeti kami, the fearsome guardian of the mountains. Quell your enemies’ effects with a powerful Yeti roar, and make them fear your mighty deck!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Dawn of the Dinobots
description:
Chomp and Stomp!
It’s time for some Dino-Might! Grimlock and the Dinobots face off against the evil Shockwave and Devastator, the first playable Combiner in the Transformers Deck-Building Game. Who will win in this battle of prehistoric power versus cold logic?

This is an expansion, Transformers Deck-Building Game required to play.

Features:
Grimlock and the Dinobots have arrived to deliver a prehistoric punch!
Featuring Devastator, on a giant-sized card, as the first playable Combiner!
New player cards for even more variety!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Beasts of Balance: Fancyprance the Fabulous Unicorn
description:
Cantering in, surrounded by disco glitter and all things sparkly, is Fancyprance. Stack Fancyprance in the tower to summon this rainbow-pooping popinjay into your world. Add this mane attraction in Co-op mode mode to unlock a host of weird and wonderful new hybrid Beasts including Squigglehorn and Heavenly Hoghoof. Play in Battles mode once all your elements have been stacked and use Fancyprance’s powerful rainbow poop to boost your region’s score.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Take That

name: Mustangs: Expansion Module
description:
This expansion includes air unit counters for 62 additional aircraft types, giving the original game of Mustangs greater flexibility and play value.

Extends Mustangs to the early days of World War II and contains fighter types not only from the U.S., Germany, and Japan, but also from other aircraft producers such as Great Britain, Italy, and the Soviet Union.

A set of 15 additional counters covering aircraft such as the British Defiant, the French Potez 631, German He-162 and Me-163 were issued to subscribers of the General in Vol. 30, No. 6 issue.

Expands:

Mustangs
categories: Aviation / Flight, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Dinosaur Island: Space Dinosaur Promo
description:
This Promo item is a fun Godspeed themed add-on compatible with our hit game Dinosaur Island - not for use in Godspeed.

Includes:
1 Space Raptor Dinosaur Tile
1 Set of 4 Space Raptor Meeples (first printing are pink, second printing are black)
1 Astronaut Specialist Card
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Walking Dead Board Game: The Best Defense – Woodbury Expansion
description:
The Woodbury Expansion for The Walking Dead Board Game: The Best Defense brings a whole new challenge to an already desperate group of Survivors. The Survivors may now visit the Woodbury Location and take their chances with the Resource Deck there, but must also avoid The Governor or he'll gun down anything in his path! The Woodbury Expansion now allows up to five players to play at once and offers an alternate win condition.

The Woodbury Location is added to the standard game set-up by placing it adjacent to two of the four starting Location tiles. Survivors sneaking into Woodbury can take their chances with the Woodbury Resource deck there. These cards have big highs and devastating lows. Examples include: Seduced, Assault Rifle, Enter the Arena, and Bargaining Chip. However, as a well-maintained and protected enclave, the good stuff outweighs the bad — and there aren't very many Walkers to deal with there!

Alternate Victory Condition: If your team of Survivors can draw up all of the Woodbury cards or find other ways to deplete the entire Woodbury deck, the Survivors win the game! The Woodbury deck begins the game with five cards per Survivor (plus a base five cards), so it's a well-balanced objective no matter how many Survivors there are.

Watching over everything is The Governor. Armed with his heavy Assault Rifle, he moves around the board causing all sorts of problems for the Survivors. However, with careful planning and some risk management, crafty players can get The Governor to help clean up pockets of Walkers. Just don't get too close to him when the bullets start flying, or you might get caught in the crossfire!

The Governor is an automated game piece on the board that moves to a new Location each round and creates plenty of panic. Alternately, the expansion provides a new "Versus Mode" where one player takes on the role of The Governor and works against all of the Survivors! The Survivor players must now win the game as a team or else The Governor player wins it all for himself. Instead of using automated or randomized movement, a player in control of The Governor can move at his own discretion, turning The Walking Dead Board Game: The Best Defense into a five-player game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Crossbowmen
description:
When it comes to training soldiers, crossbowmen require a lot less work than average. The real cost comes in the production of the crossbow, itself. Technological advances aren't cheap, and keeping weapons in working order during war is no easy task. Still, a family with resources like the Lannisters can afford to keep this ranged killing machine armed and ready for battle.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Crossbowmen unit box contains twelve miniature figures in four different sculpts, one unit card, and one movement tray. This unit of deadeye soldiers takes advantage of the technology available to a family of means. At close or long range, their bolts can pierce even thick armor. However, a wise commander will keep them away from melee charges, if possible.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

description:
The kit contains the following extra materials allowing up to 6 players to participate or to run two games simultaneously:

- 12 Art of War cards

- 6 Omphalos cards

- 6 Omphalos objects

name: Ashes Reborn: The Artist of Dreams
description:
Hope Everthorn uses illusion and time magic to sculpt the dreams of their foes, challenging their notions of reality and fantasy! Use Hope's duplication abilities to swarm foes with conjured spirits!

Use this prebuilt deck to take down your opponents,or combine Hope's cards with your favorite Ashes spells and allies to customize a new deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Resident Evil: The Board Game – Bleak Outpost
description:
Enter the Guard House and underground Aqua Ring in tense new scenarios featuring sinister new mechanics. You’ll encounter flooded tiles, undead insects, the ferocious Neptune, and the constant threat of Plant-42’s searching vines dragging you into the depths...

Are you brave enough to explore this strange world and face these two huge new bosses, so large they take up multiple squares?

Including six gripping new scenarios, this expansion adds 8 hours of extra gameplay to your Resident Evil: The Board Game campaigns. Or, play each scenario as a terrifying standalone experience.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game
